[[File:David Hicks 12 January 1966.jpg|thumb]] On [[12 January]] [[1966]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to David Hicks'''.{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienguide.com/modules/wordpress/archives/333|articlename=Tolkien signed letter for auction online at RR Auction|dated=15 April 2013|website=Guide|accessed=18 April 2013}}{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienguide.com/modules/newbb/viewtopic.php?topic_id=1798|articlename=Tolkien letter to David Hicks|dated=13 December 2013|website=Guide|accessed=18 April 2013}} *'''Subject:''' Tolkien gives his opinion about pictures sent to Tolkien by Mr. Hicks. ==Transcription== {{blockquote|Dear Mr. Hicks,

Thank you very much for your birthday greetings. I am, in fact, writing more about the world of The Lord of the Rings, though the time I have to spare, which is not much, is much cut into by my correspondence.

I am herewith sending back to you the pictures you kindly let me see. Some of them interested me; none of them enraged me.

Yours sincerely,

J.R.R. Tolkien}} ==From the auction== TLS, one page, 5.25 x 7, blindstamped personal letterhead, January 12, 1966. Letter to an admirer. In full: “Thank you very much for your birthday greetings. I am, in fact, writing more about the world of ''The Lord of the Rings'', though the time I have to spare, which is not much, is much cut into by my correspondence. I am herewith sending back to you the pictures you kindly let me see. Some of them interested me; none of them enraged me.” In fine condition, with a few light creases. Tolkien’s stories grew to be extremely popular by the 1960s, leading him to be inundated with fan mail. However, he continued to write, publishing ''The Tolkien Reader'' and ''The Road Goes On'' in the years following this letter.
